required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Robot-assisted Gait Training According to Gait Speed in Participants With Stroke
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Robot-assisted Gait Training According to Gait Speed in Participants With Stroke

brief_summary.textblock: Comparison of the experimental group that applied the speed of the robot-assisted gait training constantly and the control group that applied the gradual increase of the speed of the robot-assisted gait training.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 1 weeks after baseline, 3 weeks after baseline
baseline, 1 weeks after baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 3 weeks after baseline
baseline, 1 weeks after baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 3 weeks after baseline
baseline, 1 weeks after baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 3 weeks after baseline
baseline, 1 weeks after baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 3 weeks after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: the amount of oxygen consumed while sitting at rest and is equal to 3.5 ml O2 per kg body weight x min

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 1 weeks after baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 3 weeks after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: oxygenated hemoglobin concentration of cortical activation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 1 weeks after baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 3 weeks after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: deoxygenated hemoglobin concentration of cortical activation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 1 weeks after baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 3 weeks after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Fugl-Meyer Assessment uses to examine the motor function and coordination of affected lower extremity. It includes 17 items of a 3-point ordinal scale, ranging 0-34, with higher scores indicating lower impairment.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 1 weeks after baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 3 weeks after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Functional Ambulation Category is used to assess gait ability with 6 levels ranging from 0 to 5 on the basis of the amount of physical support required, regardless of use of an assistive device

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 1 weeks after baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 3 weeks after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: 10m walk test is used to examine gait speed, in which participant was asked to walk on a 14 meter of walkway wearing harness with two conditions; with the fastest speed or with self-selected comfortable speed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 1 weeks after baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 3 weeks after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: simple test used to assess a person's mobility and requires both static and dynamic balance

arm_group.description: experimental group that applied the speed of the robot-assisted gait training constantly
control group that applied the gradual increase of the speed of the robot-assisted gait training

intervention.description: The speed of the robot-assisted gait treatment is constantly applied for 5 times a week for 2 weeks.
The speed of the robot-assisted gait treatment is gradually increase for 5 times a week for 2 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Hemiplegic patients secondary to first cerebrovascular accidents
- Functional ambulation category score â‰¥ 3
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of surgery of affected lower limb
- Fracture of affected lower limb
